algorithm_technique: Optimized Sieve of Eratosthenes by only considering odd numbers.
Linear Sieve of Eratosthenes for prime generation.
problem_summary_simple: Count the number of prime numbers strictly less than a given integer n.
problem_summary_technical: Applies the Sieve of Eratosthenes, optimizing by only checking odd numbers and using a boolean array to mark non-primes.
key_insights: The Sieve of Eratosthenes is the standard efficient algorithm for prime counting.
Optimization by skipping even numbers (except 2) significantly reduces computations.
The constraint `i * i >= n` is a key optimization for the sieve.
Linear sieve ensures each composite number is marked by its smallest prime factor.
This approach is more complex but achieves linear time complexity.
